godlygeek, rar e file.rar: for file in `ls --color=none *.rar`; do rar e $file; done
a more robust way is: find . -name '*.rar' -exec rar e \{} \;
even better better is, find /some/dir -name '*.rar' -maxdepth=0 -exec rar e \{} \;
if there are any spaces in the file names though, it will break.  Find doesn't have that problem.
I just discovered that....Let me see if I can't get that find to work.
to get ride of all the spaces, rename 's/ //g' *.rar
in linux, . means the current directory and .. means up one directory.
my bad.  I don't use that switch very often.
